learning_outcomes.description: Construct, test and evaluate scientific hypotheses regarding the biota of ecosystems using bioanalytics approaches
Initiate and optimise sampling programs and experiments for answering biology-related questions in environmental science
Evaluate and critique biological research projects and assign priority to the outcomes
Identify appropriate analytical approaches for biological hypotheses and datasets
Make inferences from bioanalytics analyses presented in primary environmental science literature
Understand how environmental bioanalytics approaches can be applied to environmental studies and monitoring
Evaluate and design strategies to communicate bioanalytics to different environmental stakeholders
Create, analyse and evaluate bioanalytics datasets
Work productively in a group setting to assess and define problems in environmental science and formulate possible bioanalytics responses
Demonstrate skills in time management and working independently to complete written exercises on time

assessments.due_date:
10/10/2025 5:00 pm

The submission should be during class hours.
assessments.task_description:
Students will be marked for participation in all lab and computer practicals and for recording notes and reflections for each of the topics covered in each session.


Notes from the practical classes should be recorded on the left page.

Reflections should be recorded on the right page.


For each practical:

Notes should include relevant facts, figures, drawings and/or statistics from each activity.

Reflections should include how the activities relate to the subjects in your course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your journal in-class during class hours to course staff.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each student will be assigned a dataset and a series of questions. To address the questions, students will need to analyse the data using R and report their results and interpretations.

Reports should be saved as a pdf and uploaded to Turnitin by the deadline.


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In Teaching Week 12 students will present (in groups) a summary of the content of a lecture provided during the course.

You will be assigned to a group comprising 3-6 students (depending on class size).

Each group will then be assigned a lecture from the course. Within your group you will summarise the key points of that lecture and prepare a presentation to emphasise those points.

This will help to reenforce the learning objectives of the lectures in previous weeks.

All students must attend the workshops in Teaching weeks 10 and 11 to ensure that they contribute to their groups performance.


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This will be a 2 hour exam consisting of short essay-style questions based around your knowledge and understanding of the issues examined.


Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Two 50 min lectures weekly providing context and theory for each topic.

Lectures link with the practical sessions within the same week.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Two 50 min lectures weekly providing context and theory for each topic. Lectures link with the practical sessions within the same week.

learning_activities.topic:
A series of laboratory and computer-based sessions

Laboratory practical classes teaching methods used to generate data.

Computing practical classes teaching how to process, analyse and interpret bioanalytical datasets.

Workshops to discuss methods and analyses.
learning_activities.topic_title: A series of laboratory and computer-based sessions
learning_activities.topic_description: A series of laboratory and computer-based sessions Laboratory practical classes teaching methods used to generate data. Computing practical classes teaching how to process, analyse and interpret bioanalytical datasets. Workshops to discuss methods and analyses.

learning_activities.topic:
Group presentations

During the course you will form groups. In Teaching Week 10 each group will identify an environmental issue and prepare a case for addressing that issue with Environmental Bioanalytical methods. In Week 12 each group will guide the class through their proposal in an oral presentation. The presentations will be 10-15 min long followed by up to 5 min questions from the audience.
learning_activities.topic_description: Group presentations During the course you will form groups. In Teaching Week 10 each group will identify an environmental issue and prepare a case for addressing that issue with Environmental Bioanalytical methods. In Week 12 each group will guide the class through their proposal in an oral presentation. The presentations will be 10-15 min long followed by up to 5 min questions from the audience.
